page.title: 10LOCAL HISTORY OAKWOOD,SHROPS
page.content: 1985 has been a very exciting year. The Rushbury District Record Trust, the local history society,commissioned the Clwyd and Powys Archaeologist to fly over the area and take aerial photographs of the known Ancient Monuments,sites and also sites not plotted which are common knowledge in the parish. The most interesting possibility is that there might have been a Roman Villa at Oakwood,between Cardington and Longville OS 526947. A local resident remembers an oak tree falling down in 1927 and a tessellated floor being uncovered,but promptly covered over,thus securing it's preservation for the future. If only we could locate it!
